data.title: Allow using DX9Ex in DirectX renderer
data.body:
This commit enables DirectX 9EX feature inside DX9 renderer for T3D.
I already saw that there was code for support, so this commit only enables feature what is already present inside T3D, but for some unknown reason to me it was never enabled or used.

see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ee890072(v=vs.85).aspx for further details.

data.title: allows vehicle on vehicle collisions to bump each other around
Iqm model format support
data.body:
Would be great if the relatively new, but by now defacto standard for open-source FPS engine model format .iqm was supported in Torque3d:
http://lee.fov120.com/iqm/

Main reason: as nice as collada sounds on paper, as much of a mess to import and export is it in reality, especially with Blender currently. .iqm on the other hand works very well and is supposed to be really easy to implement too.

data.title: Invalid File in V3.0
data.body:
Whilst making a tutorial video on installing my pack, I discovered a little problem in the engine. Apparently someone thought it was a good idea to change the location of event.h and not do a thorough check of all of the impacted files.

Two problems have arisen due to this change.
1. consoleFunctions.cpp (Line 33): 
   You need to change the #include to be #include "platform/input/event.h".
2. consoleFunctions.cpp (Line 1589):
   return Platform::displaySplashWindow(); is missing a variable apparently.

data.title: Ground Cover Material Issue

milestone.description: This release is the first that the new Steering Committee will be responsible for. Our aims are to process as many existing outstanding issues/pull requests as possible and implement good practises for the future of the engine, such as automatic compile/unit testing of pull requests, as well as managing the different release files.

data.body:
Torque 3D v. 3.0

Add a ground cover object using any texture for the plane objects. Open the material editor, for said object. Click on the glow option for the material and the engine crashes. Not sure why this is happening, not sure how to fix it. See this link for further details:
http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/134593

data.title: ITickable, deletion inside advanceTime
data.body:
Adds a fix for when an ITickable object deletes itself inside the advanceTime procedure.
As discussed [here](http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/134512)

Kudos to David Wyand for [this thread](http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/39389) which explains the issue and helped me alot.

data.body:
Adds a fix for when an ITickable object deletes itself inside the advanceTime procedure.
As discussed [here](http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/134512)

data.title: Bullet Library v2.81
data.body: Update Bullet library to v2.81

data.title: Recast part 3: wrapper classes
data.body:
Adds NavMesh and NavPath classes that use Recast and Detour to auto-generate and pathfind on navmeshes. Also adds icons to the world editor creator menu. Basically a stripped-down version of the Recast Resource, with some architectural improvements from Walkabout.

The code is activated by including the 'navigation' module in the project generator - again, thanks to Luis Rebollo for figuring that part out.

I've decided to submit three pull requests for recast since there are three distinct sets of changes to be made.
1. #431 Adding Recast library code
2. #432 Making changes to the Torque engine to accommodate getting polys for Recast
3. This request, actual classes that wrap and make use of Recast/Detour
   I figured it would be easier to break these up - especially number 2, since people will probably have differing opinions on my changes.

data.title: Recast part 2: PLC_Navigation
data.body:
Adds a new PolyListContext value that suggests we want polygon data related to navigation. This is used by a couple of unfriendly classes, GroundPlane and TerrainBlock, to ensure that the data they pass back is actually inside the request box. Previously, both classes would give back their whole collision data in response to even a small local request.

I've decided to submit three pull requests for recast since there are three distinct sets of changes to be made.
1. #431 Adding Recast library code
2. This request, making changes to the Torque engine to accommodate getting polys for Recast
3. #433 Actual classes that wrap and make use of Recast/Detour
   I figured it would be easier to break these up - especially number 2, since people will probably have differing opinions on my changes.

data.title: Recast part 1: librecast
data.body:
Adds Recast/Detour library code in the Engine/libs directory, and a project generator module to include this code as a library. Huge credit to Luis Rebollo for showing me how to make this work.

I've decided to submit three pull requests for recast since there are three distinct sets of changes to be made.
1. This request, adding Recast library code
2. #432 Making changes to the Torque engine to accommodate getting polys for Recast
3. #433 Actual classes that wrap and make use of Recast/Detour
   I figured it would be easier to break these up - especially number 2, since people will probably have differing opinions on my changes.

data.title: Allow negative lights
data.body: Allows negative light values as per [this thread](http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/132593/). Also allows them in basic lighting as a bonus. Haven't encountered any negative (pun intended) side-effects.

data.title: Air control speed limit
data.body: The current air-control lets you accelerate to insane speeds very quickly. This change handles the acceleration the same way as when you're on the ground, so you can't accelerate to huge speeds while in the air.

data.title: Sprinting is not a pose
data.body:
Sprinting should modify movement speed within any pose, rather than being a separate pose with its own bounding box and so on. Related to #408.

I intend to work on this, but I've got no timeline; if anyone else wants to jump in, be my guest!

data.title: Arm range fix
data.body:
Previously, all arm animations were assumed to operate between +-80 degrees, and this was fixed at compile-time in `struct Player::Range`. This change makes arm animations actually depend on the `minLookAngle` and `maxLookAngle` values in the datablock.

Also cleaned up the `updateLookAnimation` function a bit since I was touching it. Basically, `dt` now represents the time delta, as usual.

data.title: Terrain import fails to update materials correctly
data.body:
When importing a terrain heightmap it fails to update materials with the associated layer images.  When importing, if you select the layer masks but do not use the "edit" button then the masks are imported but only the warning material is displayed - you can then enter the Terrain Painter and reset the terrain materials, after which the terrain will be correctly painted.  If instead you use the "Edit" button for each layer before clicking "Import" it appears that all terrain layers are replaced with layer0, though I haven't stepped through it with a debugger to be certain.

Steps:
Create a new terrain.
Paint it with various materials.
Export Terrain Heightmap.
Import Terrain Heightmap - be sure to add the layers in the import dialog.
- use the "Edit" option or not, depending on which flavor you want the issue to be.

data.title: fixed memory checking in volume
data.body: if out of memory or other memory allocation problem, it will crash otherwise

data.title: Added checks for valid pointers after locking
data.body: if locking (due to memory full, etc) failed, it was crashing with invalid memory access before

data.title: fixed pointer problems and guard in material files
data.body: Fixed pointer guards and one incorrect assignment

data.title: compile fix for rift sdk ver 0.2.2
data.body: Upgrades the T3D code to compile well with the latest Oculus Rift SDK

data.title: limiting console memory requirement
data.body:
UPDATE: BUG: do not merge, see last comment.
Limits the memory that is used to store log messages for the console to 1000 entries

data.title: fixed camera code not checking for invalid/missing datablock
data.body: Fixing crash on missing or invalid camera datablocks

data.title: Visual Studio 2012 toolchain support
data.body: Make a template for generate VS2012 solutions

data.title: QuerySingleServer Problem
data.body:
Still a present problem in T3D, Calling the command QuerySingleServer will cause the function to hang, even if the requested server exists. If there is an active server with that IP, it will fail to show the correct info with a counter of 0/0 players.

I have created three discussions regarding this in the past with no resolution to the problem found:

First One: http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/127507
Second One: http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/127537
Third One: http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/131065

I propose we re-do the current server query system to allow for PHP based solutions to function more easily, although I think a more general discussion on this problem needs to be had as it will prevent some people from getting their MP games launched properly.

data.title: There is no /shape/ subdirectory in art/particles any more.
data.body: In Empty template onServerCreated() tries to load particle data from "art/shapes/particles/" which doesn't exist anymore. Changed it to "art/particles".

data.title: error splitting mesh and image filenames
data.body:
If a mesh or Image filename has a space in them they are incorrectly
split into folders based on the spaces in the name.
so "Left Wall.dae"  would be split into "Left/Wall" etc.

data.title: Fix BitVector copy constructor.
data.body: Initialize all member variables.

data.title: Vector reserve double actual memory when increment()
data.body: fixes GarageGames/Torque3D#413

data.title: Vector increment() is very slow on large memory reallocations
data.body:
Vector increment() it's reserver memory in blocks of 16 entries. This is very slow when memory reallocation is large.

Vector need to reserve double the actual size of reserved memory to save reallocations.

data.title: Need to delete cached DTS files to see Collada changes
data.body:
According [this post](http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/134382/1#comment-845756), to see changes to a Collada model you have to delete the cached .dts file. Could we modify the engine so it watched the .dae file instead, and automatically regenerates the DTS?

I'll have a go at developing a pull-request if someone can point me at the code that watches shape files.
